channel.title: Allstar Server - Need help doubling XP needed for 99
channel.description: Well, I have ran into another problem. Kind of like the last question i asked. The EXP in HP will only down to 713, i need to figure out how i can make the EXP needed for 99 (13,034,431) Instead of (6,517,253) As this keeps me from making my HP level back down to 10. Is there anyway to do this? I think there is if you can cut it in half... you can double it.

item.title: Allstar Server - Need help doubling XP needed for 99
item.dc:creator: @i_was_here i was here
item.description:
@i_was_here wrote:

[code] public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;
if (exp > 13000000)
return 99;

    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor(
                (double) lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
        if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
        }
    }
    return 99;
}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Allstar Server - Need help doubling XP needed for 99

item.title: Allstar Server - Need help doubling XP needed for 99
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“cheezit_owns, post:3, topic:271767”]Thank you very much.

EDIT: It comes up with this error here

Player.Java:1290: ';' expected If (exp > 13034431) ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Then when i put the ; there it comes up with this error

Player.Java:1290: cannot find symbol symbol : method if(boolean) location: class Player If (exp > 13034431); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compile Successfully Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
Change the ‘If’ to ‘if’. Java is case sensitive.

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Server - Need help doubling XP needed for 99
item.dc:creator: @i_was_here i was here
item.description:
@i_was_here wrote:

use this one:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
    int points = 0;
    int output = 0;
	if (exp > 13000000)
		return 99;

    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor(
                (double) lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
        if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
        }
    }
    return 99;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Allstar Server - Need help doubling XP needed for 99
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > ########) return 99; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } }
Change the ######## to what you want the XP to be when the player’s level is 99.

Read full topic
